Abstract: Richard Bernstein article suggests that by end of 21st century the unreadability of James Joyce's Ulysses will outweigh the reverence it inspires today; photo (M)
Snippet: Richard Bernstein article suggests that by end of 21st century the unreadability of James Joyce's Ulysses will outweigh the reverence it inspires today; photo (M)
LeadParagraph: The challenge put to The Times's critics was direct: Name a 20th-century work considered ''timeless'' today that you think will be all but forgotten in 100 years. Their selections:

Headline.Main: Great Hits Headed for The Attic
Headline.PrintHeadline: VISIONS; Great Hits Headed for The Attic
